title: 109_s1787
content: The Act is titled the "Relief to Victims of Hurricane Katrina and Other Natural Disasters Act". It defines who may be a debtor. The Act, titled the "Relief to Victims of Hurricane Katrina and Other Natural Disasters Act", includes amendments to the definitions of current monthly income and natural disaster in the United States Code. The Act defines "natural disaster" as a major disaster under the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act, and "natural disaster zone" as the affected geographical area. It also defines a "victim of a natural disaster" as an individual whose financial condition is significantly impacted by damage to their primary residence in a natural disaster zone. The text discusses amendments related to individuals impacted by natural disasters, including their inability to stay at their residence or work due to a natural disaster. The definition of a "natural disaster" and "natural disaster zone" is also provided. Amendments to Chapter 5 and Chapter 7 of title 11, United States Code allow for time extensions for debtors affected by natural disasters. Amendments to Chapter 7 of title 11, United States Code now allow debtors to include actual necessary expenses resulting from natural disasters in their monthly expenses, with proper documentation and justification. Additionally, Chapter 11 has been amended to include natural disasters as qualifying events for time extensions for debtors. Amendments to Chapter 11 of title 11, United States Code now allow debtors to demonstrate inability to meet obligations due to natural disasters after providing notice to parties in interest. The amendments to Chapter 11 of title 11, United States Code allow debtors to request an extension of time due to natural disasters, with a new deadline imposed when the extension is granted. In Chapter 11 of title 11, United States Code, small businesses can now request an extension of time for deadlines in cases of natural disasters to protect creditors and the estate. The court may extend time periods for tax return filings in cases of natural disasters if the debtor is a victim and files an affidavit stating the return was lost. The court can extend time periods for tax return filings in cases of natural disasters if the debtor is a victim and files an affidavit stating the return was lost. SEC. 7. VENUE IN CASE OF NATURAL DISASTER. Section 1408 of title 28, United States Code is amended to allow individuals affected by natural disasters to file a case under title 11 in a district court where they have resided for the 30 days prior to filing, upon providing a required affidavit. Individuals affected by natural disasters can request a venue change to file a case under title 11 in a district court where they have resided for the 30 days prior to filing, by providing an affidavit stating their victim status and the necessity of the venue change due to the disaster. SEC. 8 of the Act states that it will take effect on October 18, 2005, and the amendments made by the Act will only apply to cases started under title 11, United States Code, after October 17, 2005.
